statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.headline: N.C.-Asheville 72, Charleston Southern 63
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- Matt Dickey scored a career-high 29 points and North Carolina-Asheville held off Charleston Southern 72-63 on Tuesday night in the quarterfinals of the Big South Conference tournament. The third-seeded Bulldogs (17-13), who won a season-high fourth straight game, advance to the semifinals against No. 7 seed High Point on Thursday. Trailing 46-42 with 12:23 to go, UNC Asheville used a 15-2 run, including seven points from Dickey and six from Jaron Lane, to lead 57-48 with 7:13 left. The sixth-seeded Buccaneers (16-16) got to 66-63 on a Jamarco Warren 3-pointer with 50 seconds to play, then Dickey and Lane hit two free throws apiece and John Williams sealed it with a dunk. Warren, who scored 20 points, ended his career as Charleston Southern's all-time leader in games played with 121. Kelvin Martin added 16 points, surpassing the 1,000-point mark, and 11 rebounds.
